channel.title: Need help with saving progress
channel.description:
Eh, I know, again, very noobish, but how do I save something permanatley?
Like, for example, when you start out, IsBerserker = false. But, if you talk to a guy and choose to become a Berserker, IsBerserker = true. How do I make it so that next time you log back in, IsBerserker = true still applies?
.....for those of you still confused:
[code] IsBerserker = false; [/code]
[code] (Put in a little NPC dialgoue box here) IsBerserker = true;. [/code]
How do I make it so that on next login it ignores IsBerserker = false?

item.title: Need help with saving progress
item.dc:creator: @samuraiblood2 samuraiblood2
item.description:
@samuraiblood2 wrote:

try making it save to a moreinfo file like in cheez 80

Read full topic

item.title: Need help with saving progress
item.dc:creator: @IcyPimp IcyPimp
item.description:
@IcyPimp wrote:

I get what you’re saying about saving it with the player…

but then you lost me.

Read full topic

item.title: Need help with saving progress
item.dc:creator: @Javacisnotrecognized _^_
item.description:
@Javacisnotrecognized wrote:

You can’t do that from within the client, because thats destroyed when you log off. You must go to the thing that handles the clinet.[br][size=1]Posted at: October 28, 2006, 12:44:36 AM[/size][hr]Actually, I misunderstood your question. I see the problem, and answer now. Things that are variables having to do with the player need to be saved with the player. You need to adjust the filereader to read a new line, and save it that way also. the line needs to say isBeserker = true/false, unsurprisingly.

Read full topic

item.title: Need help with saving progress
item.dc:creator: @IcyPimp IcyPimp
item.description:
@IcyPimp wrote:

Eh, I know, again, very noobish, but how do I save something permanatley?

Like, for example, when you start out, IsBerserker = false. But, if you talk to a guy and choose to become a Berserker, IsBerserker = true. How do I make it so that next time you log back in, IsBerserker = true still applies?

…for those of you still confused:

IsBerserker = false;
(Put in a little NPC dialgoue box here)
IsBerserker = true;.

How do I make it so that on next login it ignores IsBerserker = false?
